thread.title: Monday's local roundup: prep golf, tennis, soccer
thread.title_full: Monday's local roundup: prep golf, tennis, soccer

author: Staff reports
title: Monday's local roundup: prep golf, tennis, soccer
text: Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 10:16 PM Updated at 10:20 PM Posted Oct. 12, 2015 at 10:16 PM Updated at 10:20 PM Varsity girls golf The Crest High girls’ golf team won a South Mountain Athletic Conference match Monday at the River Bend YMCA Golf Club. Crest had a 147 total followed by East Burke with 156, Kings Mountain at 161 and Draughn with a 173. Crest’s Brianna Plummer and Kings Mountain’s Natalie Lutz shared medalist honors, each with a 43 score for nine holes. Crest’s other individual scores included Grace Sisk with 52, Gracie Brown at 52 and Summer McCurry with a 58. Kings Mountain also got a 57 from Sarah Drennan and 61 by Samantha Mayes. East Burke won the conference title with a team stroke total of 1,047 in seven matches. Crest was second at 1,065, Kings Mountain next at 1,121 and Draughn with 1,255. Crest’s Brianna Plummer was named the SMAC Player of the Year. She was joined on the seven-person all-conference team by fellow Charger Summer McCurry. Kings Mountain’s Natalie Lutz and Sarah Drennan made the all-league team as well. East Burke put Morgan Byles, Ellie Chung and Taylor Hildebrand on the all-conference unit. Plummer and Lutz will participate in the 3A West Regionals next Tuesday at the Monroe Country Club. Varsity girls tennis SMAC 2A tourney — Shelby High’s Keri Price advanced to the finals of the league tournament with a 6-3, 6-1 win over East Rutherford’s Bethany Bostic on Monday. Teammate Taylor Newton bested Alecia Martin 6-0, 6-0 to get a spot in the semifinals against East’s Taylor Lynn. A Newton victory would set up an all-Shelby title match. In doubles, Ally Graves and Sarah Lampley reached the semifinals with a 10-4 win over an East Burke duo. Second-day action picks up at noon Tuesday at Shelby’s David Schweppe Memorial Courts. Varsity boys soccer Crest 7, R-S Central 2 — Luke Patrick scored three goals to help the Chargers to a SMAC victory. Diego Garcia, Ronald Ramsey, Korey Blanton and Zach Sandifer also netted goals. Lawson Harrill supplied three assists. Sandifer and Cyrus Bridges had an assist each. The Chargers (8-7, 7-5 SMAC) host Burns Wednesday. Chase 7, Kings Mountain 1 — Unbeaten SMAC leader Chase rolled to a 5-1 halftime lead and handed the Mountaineers a loss Monday. Bryan Lysek delivered Kings Mountain’s only goal on a penalty kick The Mountaineers visit Cherryville on Monday and West Lincoln on Wednesday in non-conference action. College volleyball Gardner-Webb junior Taylor Lillard was named the Big South Conference volleyball player of the week for the first time in her career after posting 36 kills and a .315 hitting percentage to help lift the Runnin' Bulldogs to wins over Presbyterian and Winthrop last weekend. Page 2 of 2 - The junior outside hitter opened the weekend with a career-high 19 kills against Presbyterian, including seven in the second set, while also tallying six digs and two blocks. She followed with 17 kills against Winthrop. Lillard's recognition marks the first time GWU has earned a Big South player of the week honor. In addition, sophomore Sydney Marshall was named the league’s defensive player of the week after posting 18 blocks and 18 kills over the pair of contests. By Staff reports
